{"step_by_step_thinking": "The determination between complete and incomplete traumatic spinal cord injury is clinically relevant. This is because the type of injury can significantly impact the treatment plan and prognosis. A complete spinal cord injury means there is no function below the level of the injury, while an incomplete injury means there is some function below the level of the injury. This can affect the patient's ability to move or feel sensations. Therefore, knowing the type of injury can help doctors to predict the patient's potential for recovery and to plan appropriate rehabilitation strategies.", "answer_choice": "A"}
